title: Guatemalan woman's body returned home after fatal shooting in Indiana
description: The body of a Guatemalan woman who was killed earlier this month when she went to clean the wrong home in Indiana in the United States was returned to her native country on Sunday.  María Florinda Ríos Pérez, 32, a mother of four, was killed on the front porch of a home in Whitestown, outside Indianapolis, on Nov. 5.  Late Sunday, her mother Vilma Pérez and other relatives received her body at the capital’s international airport and planned to transport it to her hometown of Cabrican, some 125 miles (200 kilometers) west of Guatemala City.

title: Japan 'crossed a red line' with Taiwan military intervention remarks, Chinese foreign minister says
description: Japan “crossed a red line” with comments by its new leader suggesting a potential military intervention over Taiwan, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said Sunday.  Remarks earlier this month by Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi that a Chinese naval blockade or other action against Taiwan could be grounds for a Japanese military response were “shocking,” Wang said in a statement posted on the Chinese Foreign Ministry’s website.

title: Alaska Native villages have few options and little US help as climate change devours their land
description: Storms that battered Alaska's western coast this fall have brought renewed attention to low-lying Indigenous villages left increasingly vulnerable by climate change — and revived questions about their sustainability in a region being reshaped by frequent flooding, thawing permafrost and landscape-devouring erosion.  The onset of winter has slowed emergency repair and cleanup work after two October storms, including the remnants of Typhoon Halong, slammed dozens of communities.  Kwigillingok already was pursuing relocation before the latest storm, but that can take decades, with no centralized coordination and little funding.

HumanLayer (YC F24) Is Hiring Founding Engineers
description:
At HumanLayer, we’re on a mission to change how teams build software with AI. If we had a motto it would be “no vibes allowed” - we believe that AI agent-enabled coding is a deeply technical engineering craft, and we’re building CodeLayer to unlock it at scale. A Stanford study from June 2025 said AI can’t solve hard problems or work well in complex or legacy codebases, and we’re proving them wrong with advanced techniques inspired by Context Engineering (a term originally coined by our CEO Dex in April 2025). Learn more about our mission and learnings at https://hlyr.dev/ace-fca

description: My family lives about 1,000 miles from my in-laws and we rarely see them in person. My kids FaceTime their grandparents regularly to stay close.

title: My mother and I had a difficult relationship. Now, she's 90, and I'm trying to enjoy every minute I have left with her.
description: I always thought my mother was too strict, so we were never close. Now that she's a superager, I'm trying to cherish the little moments.

title: How Google is disrupting itself to beat OpenAI
description: When OpenAI unleashed ChatGPT, it awoke Google from its slumber. As Google now reimagines its business in the age of AI, big questions lie ahead.

title: How to get hired at hedge funds like Citadel, Point72, and Millennium
description: Tips on landing coveted jobs and internships at top hedge funds, from executives and recruiters.

title: A good résumé and cover letter are no longer enough. These are the creative ways job seekers are getting to the front of the line.

title: Slack cofounder says embarrassment can be motivating — but it can also lead to employees papering the office
description: Slack cofounder Stewart Butterfield said that employees should have a "perpetual desire to improve."

title: I'm the Chief People Officer at Walmart. I always wake up to the same U2 song and watch the 'Today' show.
description: Walmart's Chief People Officer, Donna Morris, typically sets her alarm clock for 6:05 a.m. and wakes up to U2's "Beautiful Day."

title: 'Walking Tall' sheriff Buford Pusser was hailed as a crime-busting hero. What if he was the killer all along?
description: Sheriff Buford Pusser's feats in Tennessee inspired the "Walking Tall" movies, plus books and songs. A new report suggests he killed his wife.

title: How one creator built a career out of making fun of your side hustle
description: Charlie Light, the mind behind the John W. Rich and Chase Passive Income parody accounts, has attracted business clients with his posts.

title: Sequoia Capital partner Shaun Maguire reveals why this industry is one of the 'most underrated'
description: Maguire said that specialty chemicals that certain companies rely on are especially important.

title: Comparing prices between Uber and Lyft could save you money, but few people do it, a new study says
description: A new study shows New York City residents pay an additional $300 million a year by failing to compare prices between Lyft and Uber.

title: 'Entitled,' 'complacent,' and 'sloppy': Inside the workplace tension at the world's largest HR organization
description: SHRM, led by Johnny C. Taylor Jr., has faced recent controversy over its DEI stances, strict internal policies, and Taylor's blunt messaging to staff.

title: I was laid off by Meta and became a boomerang employee 3 years later. Here's why I decided to return.
description: Meta boomerang employee Devang Sharma shares why he returned after a 2023 layoff and offers advice for rejoining a former employer.

title: Inside Chips Ahoy's plan to win over Gen Z — with help from Netflix's 'Stranger Things'
description: Chips Ahoy's strategy to stay relevant with Gen Z includes a cross-brand collaboration with Netflix's "Stranger Things" and its first fruity flavor.

title: Trump is floating a few risky ways to make your mortgage cheaper
description: Trump's team has been exploring new ideas to make homebuying cheaper — from 50-year loans to assumable mortgages. Here's what could go wrong.

title: The 7 parts of the US economy that are already in a recession
description: From homebuilding to trucking, major parts of the US economy are in deep trouble. The weakness could drag the whole country into a recession.

title: Secret U.S.-Russia talks led to plan that blindsided Ukraine
description: Witkoff and Dmitriev forged the plan during an October meeting in Miami that included Jared Kushner, Trump’s son-in-law, who worked with Witkoff on the Israel-Gaza peace deal.

title: Bessent says health-care announcement coming this week
description: Trump said last week he hopes to secure a plan by Jan. 30 to address an impending surge in health insurance premiums caused by subsidies that expire at end-2025.

title: AI rivals like OpenAI, Nvidia, and Oracle are collaborating to build ‘Stargate’—but a Yale expert says it violates 135 years of antitrust law
description: Six AI leaders are uniting to form a single company. How is this possibly legal, asks Madhavi Singh of Yale’s Thurman Arnold Project, an initiative dedicated to antitrust issues.

title: ‘It didn’t have to be this way’ — Top economist warns affordability crisis will continue as tariffs and immigration crackdown send inflation higher
description: "Consumer price inflation is near 3%, well above the Fed’s inflation target, and everything points to even higher inflation dead-ahead."

title: Elon Musk once called DOGE ‘the chainsaw for bureaucracy,’ but it has quietly ceased to exist well ahead of schedule, report says
description: "But, the principles of DOGE remain alive and well: de-regulation; eliminating fraud, waste and abuse; re-shaping the federal workforce; making efficiency a first-class citizen; etc."

title: Six-figure earners are ‘living the illusion of affluence’ while working side hustles, skipping meals and pretending Venmo’s not working
description: "Many top earners say people assume they can afford it all, yet behind the image of success are quiet sacrifices: skipped purchases, delayed plans, and a fragile sense of security."

title: Newsom, DeSantis join forces to blast ‘idiotic’ push to allow oil drilling off coasts of California, Florida
description: The oil industry has been seeking access to new offshore areas, including Southern California and off the coast of Florida.

title: Trump White House prepares tariff fallback ahead of court ruling
description: Both the Commerce Department and the Office of the US Trade Representative have studied Plan B options, according to officials familiar with the planning.

title: Crypto’s brutal month triggers a stress test for Wall Street

title: Fannie, Freddie shares mimic meme-stock mania with wild swings

title: Analogue's 4K Nintendo 64 Will Be Restocked November 24
description: Correction: This article's headline originally stated the Analogue 3D would be restocked November 23. The restock date is Monday, November 24, and the price increase only applies to new orders, not preorders placed last year.

title: These Games Were Missing From The Game Awards Nominations
description: Kurt and Lucy go through the 2025 Game Award categories and add a games they would have like to see nominated such as Look Outside, Keeper, Atomfall, and more.
